text: Helen Fielding (born 1958) is a British novelist and screenwriter. She is best known as the creator of the book series about the fictional character Bridget Jones. Bridget Jones's Diary (1996) and Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason (1999) were published in 40 countries and sold more than 15 million copies. The book series spawned a trilogy of movies. Ren√©e Zellweger starred as Jones. Fielding was born in Morley, West Yorkshire. She was in a relationship with American screenwriter Kevin Curran from 1999 until his death in 2016. The couple had two children. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:English novelists Category:English screenwriters Category:People from West Yorkshire
title: Helen Fielding
